code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:patient presents with mild malaise, mild fever, mild chills and Respiratory for 6 weeks. she has a history of Bronchitis for past 2 years. pt is a 37 year old white f. denies any smoking occasional EtOH o:Height 177 cm, Weight 45.1 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 16, HEENT: WNL, Cough present during interview with sputum production, all lung fields, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Bronchitis p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed Guaifenesin - 600 mg by mouth daily, and ordered CBC, Pulse Oximetry, RSV Antigen.

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

content2.Unmatched: sputum production , all lung fields , Heart = RRR , Normal S
